@axway/api-builder-plugin-invoke-flow.name: Invoke flow
@axway/api-builder-plugin-invoke-flow.description: Provides a flow-trigger and flow-nodes that can be used to invoke a flow once or multiple times, looping over an array of items.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-dc-oracle.name: Oracle
@axway/api-builder-plugin-dc-oracle.description: Connects to Oracle database and can interrogate schema to generate Models that can be used in flow orchestration, or can be used to generate a rich CRUD REST API.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-dc-mongo.name: MongoDB
@axway/api-builder-plugin-dc-mongo.description: Connects to MongoDB and can interrogate collections to generate Models that can be used in flow orchestration, or can be used to generate a rich CRUD REST API.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-dc-mssql.name: Microsoft SQL
@axway/api-builder-plugin-dc-mssql.description: Connects to Microsoft SQL Server and can interrogate schema to generate Models that can be used in flow orchestration, or can be used to generate a rich CRUD REST API.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-dc-mysql.name: MySQL
@axway/api-builder-plugin-dc-mysql.description: Connects to MySQL database and can interrogate schema to generate Models that can be used in flow orchestration, or can be used to generate a rich CRUD REST API.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-dc-mbs.name: Axway Mobile Backend Services (MBS)
@axway/api-builder-plugin-dc-mbs.description: Read and write Models to the cloud using the MBS connector. Can generate a rich CRUD REST API from Models.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-base64.name: Base64
@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-base64.description: A flow-node to encode and decode base64 strings.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-javascript.name: JavaScript
@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-javascript.description: Execute JavaScript code from the flow editor. Code is normally executed in a sandboxed mode, but an "unsafe" allows access to globals.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-json.name: JSON
@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-json.description: A flow-node to parse and stringify JSON.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-logger.name: Logger
@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-logger.description: A flow-node that can log messages from within the flow.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-mustache.name: Mustache
@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-mustache.description: A flow-node to format strings using the Mustache templating language.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-restclient.name: REST Client
@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-restclient.description: A flow-node to make HTTP requests.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-swagger.name: OpenAPI Client
@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-swagger.description: Reads OpenAPI specifications from the ./swagger directory, and generates client flow-nodes from them that can be used to orchestrate HTTP requests to existing OpenAPI services.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-ft-oas.name: OpenAPI (API-first)
@axway/api-builder-plugin-ft-oas.description: Provides support for using OpenAPI specifications to define your service as part of the API-first design process. This enables OpenAPI operations to be bound to flows, which will enable strict HTTP request and response validation as per the OpenAPI specification.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-dot.name: doT
@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-dot.description: A flow-node to format strings using the DoT templating language.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-ft-kafka.name: Kafka
@axway/api-builder-plugin-ft-kafka.description: Publish and subscribe to Kafka topics.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-ft-timer.name: Timer
@axway/api-builder-plugin-ft-timer.description: A flow-trigger that invokes a flow at configurable intervals.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-ft-cron.name: Cron
@axway/api-builder-plugin-ft-cron.description: A flow-trigger that invokes a flow at intervals using cron expressions.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-ft-solace.name: Solace
@axway/api-builder-plugin-ft-solace.description: Publish and Subscribe to Solace topics.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-xslt.name: XSLT
@axway/api-builder-plugin-fn-xslt.description: A flow-node for transforming XML using XSLT.

@axway/api-builder-plugin-prometheus.name: Prometheus
@axway/api-builder-plugin-prometheus.description: Adds Prometheus metrics in your application.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: PostgreSQL
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: Connects to PostgreSQL database and can interrogate schema to generate Models that can be used in flow orchestration, or can be used to generate a rich CRUD REST API.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: JIRA
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: Use this connector to communicate with the JIRA Cloud-Platform and make it part of your API-Management platform.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: SAP Landscape Management
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: Use this connector to communicate with the SAP Landscape Management and make it part of your API-Management platform.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: Syncplicity
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: Use this connector to communicate with Axway Syncplicity and make it part of your API-Management platform.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: AWS-Athena
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL. Athena is serverless, so there is no infrastructure to manage, and you pay only for the queries that you run. Athena is easy to use. Simply point to your data in Amazon S3, define the schema, and start querying using standard SQL.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: AWS-Lambda
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: If you would like to integrate AWS Lambda functions into your API Builder flow use this flow node. It allows you to easily call your Lambda-Functions and merge, transform or use the returned data in any way you want.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: Elasticsearch
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: Integrate Elasticsearch information into your flow using this connector.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: File
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: This node can be used to read and write files in your API Builder flow.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: Google-Maps
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: Integrate Google-Maps services into your API Builder flow using this connector. Google-Maps Services are a number of APIs provided by Google and this connector helps you to integrate with them easily.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: Object Filter
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: Filter the fields of an Object

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: XML
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: Use this extension to add an XML-Flow node to your API Builder project. With that you can convert XML-Payload you may have received from a backend stream (e.g. a SOAP-Service) into a Javascript Object for further processing or directly into a JSON-String. That allows you to easily merge data from different sources and formats into a JSON-Based-REST-API. The Flow-Node is based on the XML-JS Library.

@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.name: Redis
@axway-api-builder-ext/api-builder-plugi.description: A flow-node to communicate with Redis
